column15: American Samoa is a territory of the United States and you need to follow the correct process according to American law.
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Andorra.
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Anguilla.

If you’re asked to provide a certificate of no impediment or marital status affirmation, explain that the UK does not issue these for Commonwealth countries. Check if there’s an [information note to help explain this](https://www.gov.uk).

If you are divorced, Argentinian authorities will ask for evidence of your divorce. If you divorced in the UK, you should give them your divorce decree absolute and this [letter from the embassy](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/6531456126b9b1000daf1c17/Information_Note_-_Validity_of_Marriages.pdf).

column3: or register an opposite-sex civil partnership
column15:
Aruba is a territory of the Netherlands and you need to follow the correct process according to Dutch law.
You'll need to complete a personal declaration when you tell the Dutch authorities you intend to get married.
The British Embassy cannot give you a declaration of single status. If the Dutch authorities ask you for a declaration of single status you can show them [this letter](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/60c9f56dd3bf7f4bd73867a1/CNI_Explanatory_Letter_British_Embassy_The_Hague.pdf) explaining they're not issued any more.

If you’re asked to provide a certificate of no impediment or marital status affirmation, explain that the UK does not issue these for Commonwealth countries. Check if there’s an [information note to help explain this](https://www.gov.uk).

column10: *Austrian residence certificate (‘Meldebestätigung’) with a registered ‘Hauptwohnsitz’ - if you or your partner live in Austria (this should also be used as proof of address)
column17:
Before you apply you must have a confirmed date for your ceremony from your registry office (Standesamt) in Austria.
If you or your partner are legally resident in Austria, the proof of residence must be an Austrian residence certificate (‘Meldebestätigung’) with a registered ‘Hauptwohnsitz’.

column4: To get married in Azerbaijan either:*your partner must be an Azerbaijani national*you and your partner must have temporary residence to work or study in Azerbaijan

column15:
If you're getting married, you'll need to [apply by post for a 'certificate of custom and law for marriage'](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/affidavitaffirmation-of-marital-status-form-belgium) from the British Consulate General Brussels.
If you're registering a civil partnership, you may be asked for a certificate of marital status, signed by a [local notary public](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/lawyers) in Belgium.

If you’re asked to provide a certificate of no impediment or marital status affirmation, explain that the UK does not issue these for Commonwealth countries. Check if there’s an [information note to help explain this](https://www.gov.uk).

column16:
Your UK CNI will need to be [legalised](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) and translated. Alternatively, you can [apply to exchange your UK CNI](/exchange-uk-cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Bolivia) for a local CNI at the British embassy.
You will also need to give the registrar in Bolivia a legalised (apostilled) birth certificate. You need to [apply for legalisation separately](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised).
column17: You will also need to give the registrar in Bolivia a legalised (apostilled) birth certificate. You need to [apply for legalisation separately](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised).

column15:
Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba are territories of the Netherlands and you need to follow the correct process according to Dutch law.
You'll need to complete a personal declaration when you tell the Dutch authorities you intend to get married.
The British Embassy cannot give you a declaration of single status. If the Dutch authorities ask you for a declaration of single status you can show them [this letter](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/60c9f56dd3bf7f4bd73867a1/CNI_Explanatory_Letter_British_Embassy_The_Hague.pdf) explaining they're not issued any more.

If you’re asked to provide a certificate of no impediment or marital status affirmation, explain that the UK does not issue these for Commonwealth countries. Check if there’s an [information note to help explain this](https://www.gov.uk).
You can swear an affirmation that you’re free to get married in front of a [local notary public or commissioner of oaths](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/lawyers).
You can apply for a no trace letter from the [General Register Office](https://www.gov.uk/general-register-office).
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in the British Indian Ocean Territory.
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in the British Virgin Islands.

column17:
To apply for an affirmation in Finland you must live outside the UK. Upload your residence permit card as your proof of address and bring it to your appointment. If you cannot prove that you are resident outside the UK do not apply for this service.
If you live in the UK, you'll need to [give notice](https://www.gov.uk/marriages-civil-partnerships/give-notice) at a UK register office to get a certificate of no impediment (CNI). [Follow the guidance for British nationals living in the UK](https://www.gov.uk/marriage-abroad) to find out how to apply.

column15:
You might be asked for a: *certificate of celibacy (‘certificat de célibat’)*certificate of custom (‘certificat de coutume’)
The UK government does not issue these documents. Instead, read the guidance on [completing a self-declaration form](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/self-declaration-form-for-marriage-or-civil-partnership-pacs-in-france).

column16:
Your UK CNI will need to be legalised (apostilled) to be accepted by the Filipino authorities. You need to [apply for legalisation separately](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) once you have your UK CNI.
It may be helpful for you to include a copy of the [Philippines Statistics Authority Memorandum Circular](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/657fa6861c0c2a000d18cebe/MC-Process-for-British-Nationals-Who-Wish-to-Obtain-Marriage-License-in-the-Philippines_CAHC-signed.pdf) with your legalised UK CNI. It explains the documents British nationals resident in the UK need when getting married in the Philippines.
column17:
Once you’ve applied online, print out either an [affirmation](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/6583f40f23b70a0013234d53/Affirmation_of_Marital_Status.odt) (if you want to make a non-religious declaration) or [affidavit](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/6583f3fc23b70a000d234d53/Affidavit_of_Marital_Status.odt) (religious). Fill in your details by hand but do not sign yet. You must bring your completed form with you to your appointment at your embassy or consulate and sign it then.
You must be a resident outside of the UK to apply for this service. If you live in the UK, you need to [apply for a UK CNI](/before-you-start/apply-for-uk-cni?marriage.country=Philippines) before travelling to the Philippines.

If you live abroad or in Sweden and are not registered in the Swedish population register you'll probably need to [apply for a CNI online](https://prove-eligibility-foreign-government.forms.fcodev.org.uk/cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Sweden) and attend an appointment at the British Embassy Stockholm.
column17:
Only apply for this service if are not registered in the Swedish population register. If you are registered you should not need a CNI to get married. Check with the [Swedish Tax Authorities](https://www.skatteverket.se/privat.4.76a43be412206334b89800052864.html).
If you live in the UK you should [apply for a CNI from a UK register office](https://prove-eligibility-foreign-government.forms.fcodev.org.uk/exchange-uk-cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Sweden) unless you have already travelled to Sweden.
